system.description: The true wanderer, they are a bit like Amazons of the land. Always on the move and scouting about, rangers never like to have much responsibility if they can help it and prefer to be on their own. Gritty and worn like old leather, these characters are unflinching and realistic at all times. If you are playing a Ranger, keep watch, seek solitude, long for the woods and be introspective.

overview.base: You can @L[Category:Block abilities]{block} non-@L[Keyword:Warded]{warded} @L[Keyword:UB]{UB} @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attacks} with your @L[Category:Weapons]{weapons}. Any effects that would turn off or cut through @L[Keyword:Resistance]{resistances} affect this as well.

You may @L[Ability:Stand Up]{Stand Up} or @L[Ability:Drop Prone]{Drop Prone}. If, after doing this, you would no longer be able to be hit by the triggering @L[Category:Abilities]{ability}, it @L[Core:Fizzles]{fizzles} against you and any @L[Category:Equipment]{equipment} you bear.
overview.proficient: You may now @L[Ability:Move]{Move} instead of using @L[Ability:Stand Up]{Stand Up} or @L[Ability:Drop Prone]{Drop Prone}. The maximum distance you can @L[Ability:Move]{Move} is 5 × @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} feet. This also does not trigger @L[Ability:Opportunity Attack]{Opportunity Attack}.

system.trigger: You would or some @L[Category:Equipment]{equipment} you @L[Keyword:Bearing]{bear} would be hit by an @L[Category:Active abilities]{active} or @L[Category:Reactive abilities]{reactive} @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attack} you can see.

overview.base: You recognize details about living species by sight. If the target is a species you know of, you recognize it even if it is obscured or @L[Condition:Disguised]{disguised}. If the target is not of a species you've seen before, the @L[Core:GM]{GM} may still provide you with some information about it, such as if there's similar species you would recognize. If the target is @L[Category:Corporeal undead creatures]{undead}, you recognize only its "original" species, if it had one (or anything remains of it).

Pick 1 species you're familiar with. Your allies have @L[Keyword:Gifted]{Gifted} @L[Ability:Snare]{Snare} against creatures of that species. You also have @L[Keyword:Limited]{Limited} @L[Ability:Flanking]{Flanking} against creatures of that species.
overview.proficient: You may instead pick up to @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} species you're familiar with.
overview.fluent: You may instead pick up to @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} species you're familiar with.

overview.base: You have @L[Core:Advantage]{advantage} on @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attack rolls} against creatures that are within 5 feet of an ally of yours that isn't incapacitated and that you can see.

system.limitation: You only get the benefits of Flanking against creatures of the species you chose.
